definition: double-ended skin drum with a narrow waist
Jie people, a tribe of northern China around the 4th century
drum/CL:通[tong4],面[mian4]/to drum/to strike/to rouse/to bulge/to swell
drumming to make apricots flower, cf joke by Tang Emperor Xuanzhong 唐玄宗, playing the drum in apricot blossom

sentences.english: So, It is a significative work to clear up《Jie Gu lu》.
sentences.chinese: 因此，整理《羯鼓錄》是一項富有意義的工作。

definition: pipa, Chinese lute, with 4 strings, a large pear-shaped body and a fretted fingerboard
ancient bamboo reed instrument/Chinese shawm (probably related to central Asian zurna)
xiao, a Chinese musical instrument of ancient times, similar to panpipes
guzheng or long zither/long zither with 13 to 16 strings, developed from guqin 古琴 during Tang and Song times/Japanese koto
huqin/family of Chinese two-stringed fiddles, with snakeskin covered wooden soundbox and bamboo bow with horsehair bowstring
sanxian, large family of 3-stringed plucked musical instruments, with snakeskin covered wooden soundbox and long neck, used in folk music, opera and Chinese orchestra
